name: Read and Reflect
description: Choose a Category to Start Your R&R

backbone.name: Backbone
backbone.description: These blog posts will help you get up and running with Backbone.

concepts-in-backbone.description: Read this first part of the series to get an idea of the pieces of a Backbone application. Most of them will probably be familiar already!
concepts-in-backbone.instructions: Be sure to take your time reading the article. There are a lot of subtle points you could miss if you rush through it.
concepts-in-backbone.name: Concepts in Backbone

intro-to-writing-code-with-backbone.description: This article provides another high-level overview of Backbone, code examples, and help with how the pieces tie together.
intro-to-writing-code-with-backbone.name: Introduction to Writing Code with Backbone

hello-backbone.description: These heavily commented code examples help you go from building simple apps to more complex ones.
hello-backbone.name: Hello Backbone

routers-in-backbone.description: Learn how to link the URL (also called the route) of your application with the view being showed.
routers-in-backbone.name: Routers in Backbone

user-input-controls.name: User Input Controls
user-input-controls.description: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipisicing elit. Eaque praesentium, temporibus officia sapiente totam, in molestiae, fugit corrupti suscipit aut architecto beatae vel et. Sed sint debitis voluptatibus error odit.

toggle-button.name: How do you use a toggle button in Android?
toggle-button.description: Follow the instructions in this blog to learn how to use a toggle button by creating a new android app from scratch

edit-text.name: Best ways of using an Edit Text in your app
edit-text.description: Read this blog and learn how you can use EditText inside your own apps.

autocomplete.name: How does one use Autocomplete in a mobile app?
autocomplete.description: In this blog you will find instructions on how autocomplete works in the Android ecosystem. Create a new app and practice how to incorporate Autocomplete within it.

mvc-in-android.name: Is there an MVC pattern in Android?
mvc-in-android.description: Read this Stackoverflow entry to learn more about how MVC is accomplished in Android.
